content:
Hi all,

Would there be any interest of a port of HAPI (http://hapifhir.io/) for PHP, based on Laravel? I've toyed with setting this up in the past but wanted to gauge the community interest in such an effort.
PHP and Java are really different beasts. What does a PHP port of HAPI mean? A full blown server with all the back end code?

Agreed. Yes that would be the overall goal - understandably it would not be a 1:1 class replication kind of thing but instead a lean on some of the concepts in HAPI such as the resource providers, interface examples, etc.
I already have a name, PHPAPI FHIR :grinning:

Hi im also new in fhir and I came across this channel hoping to know some people who is working on fhir using php. I found this library https://github.com/dcarbone/php-fhir, though I haven't used this yet in my project. I want to know some inputs from you guys about php + fhir. thanks :)

Matthew Koch said:

Hi all,

Would there be any interest of a port of HAPI (http://hapifhir.io/) for PHP, based on Laravel? I've toyed with setting this up in the past but wanted to gauge the community interest in such an effort.

I am personally not interested, but I know a team who would be!
